abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.p: Magnetic field is generated by the passage of electrical currents through conductors or by the circulation of microscopic charges within magnetic materials. The magnetic field exerts a mechanical stress on its sources.

ref.mixed-citation: For a detailed discussion of the magnetosphere and its interaction with the solar wind see, for example, Akasofu, S. I., and Chapman, S., “Solar Terrestrial Physics” 901 pp., London, Oxford Univ. Press, 1972, and Williams, D. J. (Ed.), “Physics of Solar Planetary Environments,” 1038 pp., Washington, D.C., American Geophysical Union, 1976. For a brief summary of other magnetosphere systems see Stern, D. P., and Ness, N. F., “Planetary Magnetospheres,”Annual Review of Astronomy and Astrophysics20 (1982).

ref.mixed-citation: Gerstenkorn, S., and Luc, P., “Atlas du Spectre d’Absorption de la Molécule d’Iode (14 80020 000 cm-1),” Paris, Editions du C.N.R.S., 1978. A correction to the atlas is given in Gerstenkorn, S., and Luc, P.,Revue de Physique Appliquée14, 791 (1979). Subtraction of 0.0056 cm-1from all wavenumbers in the atlas results in an absolute accuracy of 0.002 cm-1And a relative accuracy of 0.0007 cm-1.

See papers in Hall, J. L., and Carlsten, J. L. (Eds.), “Laser Spectroscopy,” Vol. III, Berlin, Springer-Verlag, 1977; and in Walther, H., and Rothe, K. W. (Eds.), “Laser Spectroscopy,” Vol. IV, Berlin, Springer-Verlag, 1979.
